intro: Hydrangea serrata var. coreana, commonly known as the Korean hydrangea, is a deciduous shrub native to East Asia. It is characterized by its large, showy inflorescences that can range in color from blue to pink depending on soil pH. The plant features serrated leaves and produces small, white flowers that develop into round, woody fruits. It thrives in partial shade and moist, well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for garden landscapes. Its ornamental value and adaptability contribute to its cultivation in temperate climates.
